TopicTitle: Basic Mod - Adding an EVA hatch

Articles.Content:
I'm using a part from a now-defunct mod. It's a command module part. I've got it working in 1.0 and everything appears normal about it.

The part was created before EVA's were prevalent in KSP. I'd like to add an EVA hatch to the part but I do not know how. I've not done modeling with the programs KSP uses. I am decent with the basic part code (i.e. I can change parameters around without making weird stuff happen.)

How do I put an EVA hatch on a part that does not have one?
After looking I believe it is something that you add in the Unity stage of part creation. I suggest looking up a tutorial for making a command pod specifically the Unity part.
This should help. And even more here under airlock.
There are some videos on IVA parts, all Video Tutorials Here

Do you mean a "Crew Hatch" that would allow you to exit the ship by clicking the EVA button on your Kerbal's portrait? Or a prop in IVA view that would trigger EVA?

If the part does not have a Crew Hatch already, you need to model one and assign it a hatch collider in Unity.
